name: Adobo
instructions: 1. Marinate meat in soy sauce, vinegar, and garlic. 2. Brown meat in oil. 3. Add marinade, bay leaves, and pepper. 4. Simmer until tender.

name: Sinigang
instructions: 1. Boil pork until tender. 2. Add tomato and onion. 3. Add tamarind mix and vegetables. 4. Season with fish sauce. Simmer until done.

name: Chicken Tinola
instructions: 1. Saut√© ginger, onion, and garlic. 2. Add chicken and brown. 3. Add water and simmer. 4. Add papaya and chili leaves. Season with fish sauce.

name: Kare-Kare
instructions: 1. Boil oxtail and pork until tender. 2. Make peanut sauce with annatto. 3. Add vegetables and simmer. 4. Serve with bagoong.

name: Pancit Canton
instructions: 1. Saut√© garlic and onion. 2. Add meat and cook. 3. Add vegetables and soy sauce. 4. Add noodles and mix well.

name: Lumpia Shanghai
instructions: 1. Mix ground pork with vegetables and egg. 2. Wrap mixture in lumpia wrapper. 3. Deep fry until golden brown. 4. Serve with sweet chili sauce.

name: Bistek Tagalog
instructions: 1. Marinate beef in soy sauce and lemon juice. 2. Fry onion rings and set aside. 3. Cook beef until tender. 4. Top with fried onions.

name: Lechon Kawali
instructions: 1. Boil pork belly with bay leaves and pepper. 2. Let dry and rub with salt. 3. Deep fry until crispy. 4. Serve with lechon sauce or vinegar.

name: Beef Caldereta
instructions: 1. Saut√© garlic and onion. 2. Brown beef. 3. Add tomato sauce and liver spread. 4. Add vegetables and simmer. 5. Add cheese before serving.

name: Ginataang Hipon
instructions: 1. Saut√© ginger, garlic, and onion. 2. Add shrimp and cook. 3. Add coconut milk and vegetables. 4. Simmer until vegetables are tender.

name: Pinakbet
instructions: 1. Saut√© ginger, onion, and tomato. 2. Add pork and cook. 3. Layer vegetables and add bagoong. 4. Simmer until vegetables are tender.

name: Chicken Afritada
instructions: 1. Saut√© garlic and onion. 2. Brown chicken. 3. Add tomato sauce and bay leaves. 4. Add vegetables and simmer until tender.

name: Sisig
instructions: 1. Boil and grill pork until crispy. 2. Chop finely with liver. 3. Saut√© with onion and chili. 4. Season with calamansi and soy sauce. Top with egg.

name: Beef Nilaga
instructions: 1. Boil beef with onion and pepper until tender. 2. Add corn and potato. 3. Add cabbage and string beans. 4. Season with fish sauce.

name: Pork Menudo
instructions: 1. Saut√© garlic and onion. 2. Brown pork and liver. 3. Add tomato sauce and vegetables. 4. Add raisins and simmer until done.

name: Chicken Inasal
instructions: 1. Marinate chicken in calamansi, vinegar, lemongrass, and spices. 2. Grill chicken while basting with annatto oil. 3. Serve with rice and atchara.

name: Laing
instructions: 1. Saut√© ginger, garlic, and onion. 2. Add pork and cook. 3. Add taro leaves and coconut milk. 4. Add shrimp paste and simmer.

name: Dinuguan
instructions: 1. Saut√© garlic and onion. 2. Add pork and cook. 3. Add vinegar and simmer. 4. Add pork blood and season. Serve with puto.

name: Tortang Talong
instructions: 1. Roast and peel eggplant. 2. Flatten and dip in beaten egg. 3. Fry until golden. 4. Serve with ketchup or vinegar.

name: Bicol Express
instructions: 1. Saut√© garlic, onion, and ginger. 2. Add pork and cook. 3. Add coconut milk and shrimp paste. 4. Add chili and simmer until thick.

name: Paksiw na Bangus
instructions: 1. Layer bangus, garlic, onion, ginger, and eggplant in a pot. 2. Add vinegar, water, peppercorn, and salt. 3. Simmer covered until fish is cooked and flavors meld.

name: Daing na Bangus
instructions: 1. Marinate butterflied bangus in vinegar, garlic, salt, and pepper (overnight if possible). 2. Pat dry and pan-fry until crispy. 3. Serve with rice and vinegar dip.

name: Escabeche (Sweet and Sour Fish)
instructions: 1. Season and dredge fish in flour, then fry until golden. 2. Stir-fry ginger, garlic, onion, carrot, and bell pepper. 3. Add vinegar, sugar, and ketchup to make sauce. 4. Pour over fish and serve.

name: Sarciadong Isda
instructions: 1. Fry fish and set aside. 2. Saut√© garlic, onion, and tomatoes until soft. 3. Add water and season with fish sauce and pepper. 4. Return fish and pour beaten eggs; simmer briefly until eggs set.

name: Sinigang na Isda
instructions: 1. Boil tamarind broth with onion and tomato. 2. Add radish, okra, and eggplant. 3. Add fish and simmer gently until cooked. 4. Add kangkong and green chili; season with fish sauce.

name: Inihaw na Bangus
instructions: 1. Stuff bangus with chopped tomato, onion, and ginger; season with calamansi, salt, and pepper. 2. Wrap in banana leaves. 3. Grill until fish is cooked and slightly charred.
